intro: Lygistum racemosum, commonly known as the racemose lygistum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in racemes. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Lygistum racemosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
